NEWS BITES

Home Sales Rise Across Canada in September September proved to be another strong month for Canadian home sales and prices as the housing market recovers from a slump earlier this year. Sales rose by 0.6% last month, marking a 16% year-over-year jump, according to the Canadian Real Estate Association. Prices rose in September by 0.5%, marking a 2.3% increase over the past four months. BNN Bloomberg

U.K. Property Sells the Quickest in Scotland Properties are averaging 45 days on the market in Glasgow, Scotland, and 47 days in Edinburgh. That’s compared to the slowest-selling, least-affordable cities in the U.K., such as Oxford, where properties spend an average of 152 days on the market, according to the Centre for Economics and Business Research. On average, U.K. properties take 114 days—two weeks longer than last year—to sell. PropertyWire

England’s Asking Prices Inch Upward in October Asking prices in England and Wales rose 0.3% month-over-month and by 0.1% year-over-year in October to an average of £309,692 (US$394,544), according to the latest index from Home.co.uk. This marks the first month of positive price growth in England and Wales after eight straight months of negative growth. PropertyWire

Former Saudi Arabian Embassy Property in Singapore is Put on the Market A house that was formerly occupied by the Royal Embassy of Saudi Arabia in Singapore is for sale for S$175 million (US$127.45 million). The land spans 58,784 square feet, and the two-story, 13,839-square-foot property features four en-suite bedrooms and an internal, landscaped courtyard. Business Times
